Authors:
Daria Erastova, Mikhail V. Okun, Anna Maria Fiore-Donno,
Yuri K. Novozhilov, Martin Schnittler
Title:
Changes in phylogenetic position of enigmatic myxomycete
Kelleromyxa fimicola based on SSU rDNA sequences â€“ a rise of the new
family in the dark-spored clade
Keywords:
Molecular phylogeny, Mycetozoa, Myxomycetes, slime molds,
SSU rRNA gene
Abstract:
The coprophilous myxomycete Kelleromyxa fimicola (Dearn.
& Bisby) Eliasson was first described in 1929 as Licea fimicola
Dearn. & Bisby. Based on the superficial resemblance of its
sporocarps to those of Licea biforis the species was placed within the
order Liceales which belongs to the bright-spored clade. However,
detailed studies on morphology and life cycle revealed some characters
of the order Physarales. To elucidate the systematic position of K.
fimicola we obtained three partial and one complete sequence of the SSU
rDNA. A comparsion with recent myxomycete phylogenies based on SSU
sequences revealed a clear relationship of K. fimicola to the order
Physarales. However, the obtained sequences are not closely related to
any of the two known families of Physarales, supporting the erection of
a monotypic genus for this species. Along with morphological
observations our data allow to exclude K. fimicola from the order
Liceales and define its place within the dark-spored clade of
myxomycetes among the order Physarales.
